note.p: Career: Staff, College du France, Paris (1851); Professor of Organic Chemistry, Ecole Superieure de Pharmacie (1859); Professor of Organic Chemistry, College de France (1865); Perpetual Secretary, Academy of Sciences, Paris (1889); Minister of Public Instruction (1886-1887); Minister of Foreign Affairs (1895-1896)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1907-1908 vol 80 pp iii-x signed by W R
